prompt: What is AHIL?
completion:
AHIL is a programming language that runs exclusively on computers running on the Windows 10 and Windows 11 operating systems. AHIL is an 
acronym that stands for Auto Helm Intermediate Language. It is a simple language that is used for basic automation tasks. It is a programming language where all code
 is run sequentially. AHIL programs are commonly referred to as workflows, writting a workflow means to write a program using AHIL code

prompt: How does AHIL work semantically? What does the basic langiage structure look like?
completion:
There are NO user-defined functions, classes, objects, 
if statements, or variables. AHIL code is used in order to complete simple tasks, often interacting with the Windows GUI, and making some API calls handling tasks behind the scenes. Each line of code represents a 
differnt function call, from the pre-defined syntax. Only the pre-defined functions from the syntax described can be used. Users have control over the parameters used 
with the functions provided by AHIL. There are no comments in AHIL code, so no in-code explanations/comments are ever made. All keywords and function names begin with 
capital letters. Each new function is seperated by a new line. A function parameter is seperated from a function keyowrd by a single space. In the case of multiple 
parameters being provided to a function, each parameter value after the first parameter will be seperated by a space.

prompt:
in AHIL, SwitchWindow is a function which will switch which window is currently active. It will switch to an open application window with the title that is 
specified. The parameter to this function will be the open application window name, in double quotes. for example: SwitchWindow "Window name to switch to"

in AHIL, FileCreate is a function which will create a file at the location passed in. The parameter for this function is a full Windows file path, 
including the new file's name and extension at the end of it. the path must use the forward slash (/) between folders. The parameter to this function will be the full
 path, in double quotes. for example: FileCreate "C:/the/full/file/peath/with/folders/and/file_name.extension"

in AHIL, Run is a function that will open a .exe application, or a file on one's computer with the default application for that file's extension. The 
function's paramerter will either be the name of the application's exe file (with the .exe extension), or the full Windows path to a file on one's computer. The 
parameter must be wrapped in double quotes. for example: Run "C:/the/full/file/peath/with/folders/and/file_name.extension".

in AHIL, Sleep is a function that will pause exection for a specified amount of time, in milliseconds. The one parameter will be an interger value 
representing the amount of time to sleep for, in mullisections. for example: Sleep 2000

in AHIL, Write is a function that will type out a string with the keyboard. The string it will type is the parameter passed into this funtion, which is 
any string wrapped in double quotes.
completion: Write "This is a sample sentence that is typed out on screen."

prompt:
in AHIL, WriteLine is a function that will type out a string with the keyboard, and automatically add a new line ending by hitting the enter key. The string 
it will type is the parameter passed into this funtion, which is any string wrapped in double quotes.
completion: WriteLine "This is a sample line that is typed out on screen."

prompt:
in AHIL, Del is a function that will delete a file or folder given a specified path. There is 1 parameter to this funtion, which is the path of the file
or folder being deleted, and it is a mandatory parameter

in AHIL, PressKey is a function that will click one individual key on the keyboard. It takes in a parameter of the key to press, wrapped in double quotes.
It also supports clicking functional keys with the use of modifiers. Modifier rules are summarized as follows: modifiers for different keys and actions. The exclamation mark (!) is used for the Alt key, with {Alt} representing the Alt key, {Alt Down} for pressing it down, and {Alt Up} for releasing it. The plus sign (+) is associated with the Shift key, and the syntax includes {Shift}, {Shift Down}, and {Shift Up} for Shift key events. The caret (^) signifies the Ctrl key, with options like {Ctrl}, {Ctrl Down}, and {Ctrl Up} for Ctrl key actions. The hash (#) is used for the Windows key, and options include {LWin}, {RWin}, {LWin Down}, and {RWin Down} for Windows key events. Braces ({ }) enclose key names and other options, and are used for sending special characters literally. Additionally, there are representations for function keys ({F1} - {F24}), state keys (CapsLock, ScrollLock, NumLock), control keys (Control, Alt, Shift), mouse events, numpad keys, browser navigation keys, media and launch keys, special keys, and modifiers for key remapping such as {Blind} and {Raw} for literal interpretation.

in AHIL, SaveAs is a function that will
in AHIL, Close is a function that will
in AHIL, DirCreate is a function that will

in AHIL, MouseToWord is a function that will

in AHIL, Click is a function that will simulate a left click from the mouse. There is a set of optional parameters, which represent x and y coordinates.
These parameters are integer values, and they represent the x and y location of the mouse cursor on screen. Ths function can take in no parmaeters, in which case it 
will execute a left click at whatever the current position of the mouse cursor is. if coordinates are to be specified, both the x and y coordinates must be specfied, 
not just one.

in AHIL, For is a keyword. This represents a For loop, which works in the same manner as any other programming language. A for loop will be wrapped around
a list of statements that are then repeated a specified number of times. The parameter for a For loop is an integer, that represents the number of times the statements 
within the for loop are repeated. There must be a space between the word "For" and the number, that is wrapped in brackets. After the number wrapped in brackets,
there will be a set of curly braces that will hold the set of fucntions to be repeated. As is the case with other statements in AHIL, the functions wrapped in the
for loop will be seperated by new lines. Functions within the for loop are spaced rightward with a single tab. The current index of the For loop iteration can also
be referenced with {i}

Make a workflow that creates a new folder at the path C:/Users/Hans/Documents/Stuff/School/4A/ECE 498A/Automation_Framework/Automation_Project/tests/training/newdir.
Make a file under the new folder named output1.txt. Launch Wordpad, sleep for 500ms. Write "hello world" 5 times in separate lines. Save the file as output2.txt, under the
same folder created earlier. Close wordpad. Delete the new folder.
completion:
DirCreate "C:/Users/Hans/Documents/Stuff/School/4A/ECE 498A/Automation_Framework/Automation_Project/tests/training/newdir"
FileCreate "C:/Users/Hans/Documents/Stuff/School/4A/ECE 498A/Automation_Framework/Automation_Project/tests/training/newdir/output1.txt"
Run "wordpad.exe"
Sleep 500
For (5) {
	WriteLine "hello world"
}
SaveAs "C:/Users/Hans/Documents/Stuff/School/4A/ECE 498A/Automation_Framework/Automation_Project/tests/training/newdir/output2.txt"
Close
Del "C:/Users/Hans/Documents/Stuff/School/4A/ECE 498A/Automation_Framework/Automation_Project/tests/training/newdir"

prompt:
Generate a workflow that starts by deleting this folder if it exists: 
"C:/Users/James/Documents/School/Year 4/ECE 498A/Project/Desktop_Application/Project/tests/tests_output". Then, create the same folder again. I want to make some 
numbered group folders inside it, like 'group_1', 'group_2', up to 'group_5'. In each group folder, create a text file named 'data_1.txt', 'data_2.txt', and so on, 
matching the group number. For each text file, open it and write lines that have the group folder number, that number times 10, and that number times 100. It should 
look like a list of numbers separated by commas. After writing these lines, wait a little, save everything, and close the file.
completion:
Del "C:/Users/James/Documents/School/Year 4/ECE 498A/Project/Desktop_Application/Project/tests/tests_output"
DirCreate "C:/Users/James/Documents/School/Year 4/ECE 498A/Project/Desktop_Application/Project/tests/tests_output"
For (5){
    DirCreate "C:/Users/James/Documents/School/Year 4/ECE 498A/Project/Desktop_Application/Project/tests/tests_output/group_{i}"
    FileCreate "C:/Users/James/Documents/School/Year 4/ECE 498A/Project/Desktop_Application/Project/tests/tests_output/group_{i}/data_{i}.txt"
    Run "C:/Users/James/Documents/School/Year 4/ECE 498A/Project/Desktop_Application/Project/tests/tests_output/group_{i}/data_{i}.txt"
    For (10){
        Sleep 1000
        WriteLine "{i},{i*10},{i*100}"
    }
    Sleep 2000
    Save 
    Close
}

prompt:
Help me make a workflow that will Switch to the opened "Home" window in the file explorer. Create a text file at "C:/Users/zaidl/Desktop/auto_test.txt", 
open it, and wait for 2500 milliseconds. In a loop that repeats five times, write 'Hello [the number representing what iteration this is]' and press the "Z" key. Afterward, write "End", 
wait for 2000 milliseconds, save, and close the file "C:/Users/zaidl/Desktop/auto_test.txt". Create a folder at "C:/Users/zaidl/Desktop/test_folder", move 
"C:/Users/zaidl/Desktop/auto_test.txt" into it, delete "C:/Users/zaidl/Desktop/file_to_delete.txt", move the mouse to coordinates (0, 0), run Microsoft Paint, wait for
 200 milliseconds, move the mouse to the word "File," (it is in dark mode) and click.
completion:
SwitchWindow "Home"
FileCreate "C:/Users/zaidl/Desktop/auto_test.txt"
Run "C:/Users/zaidl/Desktop/auto_test.txt"
Sleep 2500
For (5){
    WriteLine "Hello {i}"
    PressKey "Z"
}
Write "End"
Sleep 2000
Save 
Sleep 1000
Close 
DirCreate "C:/Users/zaidl/Desktop/test_folder"
Move "C:/Users/zaidl/Desktop/auto_test.txt", "C:/Users/zaidl/Desktop/test_folder/auto_test.txt"
Del "C:/Users/zaidl/Desktop/file_to_delete.txt"
MouseMove 0, 0
Run "mspaint.exe"
Sleep 200
MouseToWord "File", "True"
Click
